data.text:
John Spence began his university studies in 1963 at the UNL School of Architecture, but after moving to the College of Fine Arts, John maintained a strong affinity with members of the UNL School of Architecture Class of 1968, and we proudly count him among our members.

Website: www.johnspencephoto.com

John Spence has a BFA and MFA in photography from the University of Nebraska. He is an award-winning photographer, filmmaker and artist whose photographs and art work are held in numerous public and private collections. He has received several commissions for large-scale landscape photographs in public buildings including the Animal Science Building in the UNL Campus. He began his career in film and video production with the Nebraska Television Network. After five years with NET he left to begin his own production company. Since then, he has shot and edited films and videotapes for a wide variety of national and local clients. He has received a Mid America Arts Alliance/National Endowment to the Arts Fellowship in photography, an Independent Film Production grant from the Southwest Alternate Media Project and a Nebraska Arts Council Individual Artist Fellowship. In 2005 he published “Close to Home”, a book of text and photographs.
